main_definition: A dozen refers to a quantity of twelve items or units, commonly used as a standard count.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Standard unit of measure for counting objects
meanings_and_examples.example: I bought ten eggs; there are two left because twenty-two minus ten equals twelve. That's one dozen.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A price marking or selling term indicating the cost of a set number of items
meanings_and_examples.example: The bakery sold boxes of cupcakes, with each box containing one dozen cupcakes at $12 per box.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In sports, it refers to scoring 12 points or more in a game (e.g., basketball)
meanings_and_examples.example: The player scored a double-double and also made three three-pointers to reach the score of twenty-four; that's one dozen.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used informally when referring to an approximate quantity
meanings_and_examples.example: I have about a dozen friends coming over, so we might need some extra food and drinks.
